This year, she became a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joylinda

texts.en: Joylinda of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental has been planting coconuts for more than six years. She earns 5,500 PHP per month. She’s 40 years old now, yet she continues to hang on with her coconut business in order to adequately provide for her four children. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In order to enhance her business, she borrows 12,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer. Joylinda hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita  tiene 67 años de edad, está casa con el Sr. Alder hace 45 años, tienen cuatro hijos, todos ya mayores que son independientes.
La Sra. Margarita es una señora muy trabajadora, ella es docente jubilada y decidió montar un negocio de venta de medicamentos en su domicilio ya que esta frente a una Clínica. Comenzó con un dispensario y luego fue creciendo.
Comenta que en su rubro hay mucha competencia, pero que aun así tiene una clientela formada y que le ayuda bastante el servicio que ofrece a la Clínica. Su sueño es dejar un negocio rentable a sus dos hijas que aún permanecen con ella, y puedan llevar adelante como un legado de vida trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de medicamentos, con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita is 67 years old, married to Alder for 45 years; they have four children, whom all are independent. 

Margarita is a very hard working person, she is a retired teacher, who decided to start a business of selling medicine from her house because it is opposite to a clinic. She began with a small pharmacy, which then continued growing. 

She says that in her business there is a lot of competition but she has a good client base and that the service that offered to the clinic helps her. Her dream is to leave a profitable business to her two daughters who are still living with her, and to be able to carry forward a legacy of working life . 

She requests the loan to purchase medications to supply her business and continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase medications to supply her business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin,  vive solo, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra una manzana de terreno, aprendió de su padre cuando era muy joven, sus horarios de trabajo son variados, porque dependen de la necesidad y de las condiciones del clima.
Actualmente está realizando una siembra, para la que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios, por esto solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de abono, pago de tractor para preparar la tierra y de los mozos, este préstamo le ayudara a tener su trabajo, su riesgo es el clima pues cuando llueve fuerte puede dañarle la siembra, su ciclo normal es sembrar, recoger la cosecha, almacenarla y vender, espera seguir de esta manera.
Su objetivo es mantener trabajo, realizarlo cada vez mejor, vender a los clientes cosecha, y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin lives alone and works in agriculture. He farms a 0.7 hectare plot of land. He learned this from his father when he was very young. His work hours vary because they depend on necessity and weather conditions.

Currently, Edwin is doing a planting for which he lacks necessary materials, so he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for workers and a tractor to prepare the land. This loan will help him to keep his job; his risk is the weather, as heavy rains can spoil the planting. His normal cycle is planting, harvesting, storing the harvest, and selling it. He hopes to continue in this way.

Edwin's goal is to keep working, to perform his work better all the time, to sell his harvest to his customers, and to generate his own income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, to hire a tractor to prepare the land, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, a 53-year-old and a mother of four children, is the operator of a rice farming business.She has been in this business for more than 20 years. She has been working every day at the rice field just to meet the needs of her daily family. Aside from rice husbandry, Sok is also engaged in making and selling Khmer cakes for extra household income but recently this business is likely to go down. Due to the financial difficulties, Sok created a buy-and-sell business, collecting recycled materials from local people to generate income to cover her daily expenses.
As of now, she has requested a loan from HKL, one of Kiva partners, to use as a sufficient capital for the purchase of recycled materials. She hopes to make her business viable and profitable someday. She is appreciated for the given fund to support her business and family.

loans.use: to use as a sufficient capital for the purchase of recycled materials.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for 41 years.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
To continue their efforts and increase the number of pigs, the Gayatri Indah group requested a second loan for the same amount. These loans are used to purchase piglets, especially the superior species. Pig breeding businesses can help increase their family income because of the easy maintenance and can be used as additional work. Most of the members work as farmers. They have hopes this effort will be more advanced, they can save money and send their children through high levels of education.
Ni Komang use her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening. She hopes  from her experiences she can keeps the pigs well, grow healthy and fat, so she she can sell it with a high price. Ni Komang also needs a routines controling by the Vet and the FO for consulting about pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en:
In order to further enhance earnings in the field of breeding pigs, Ni Putu and the whole group of Puspa Kencana continue borrowing from MUK in the same amount. They are very satisfied with the services provided, so they agreed to develop this business. 

Ni Putu will use the loan to buy three super quality piglets for later sale. She still expects the assistance of MUK in business consulting. Profits will be saved for the preparation of their children's education expenses.

One of the members, Ni Wayan, resigned because she got enough profit to run the business by herself. She also said thank you to MUK, Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: to buy three super quality piglets.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 30 years old with 3 children. She lives in Macabibo, Calamba, Philippines. 

Luzminda owns and operates a business selling a variety of used clothes (ukay-ukay) to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,200 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2010, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for  business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem is a 55-year-old widowed woman who has been living in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh city. She has been blessed with two single children, one of whom is working in a garment factory as sewing staff. Hem owns and runs a convenience store selling a variety of merchandise, including drinks, spices, snacks, noodles, and canned goods. From this business, she is able to make approximately USD $5.00 per day to cover her daily costs.

Hem is applying for a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to travel back and forth to her workplace. Also, with the remainder, she wants to buy eggs, canned food, spices, beverages, and home-use products to fill up her convenience store and increase her merchandise. Someday, she hopes she will become a successful entrepreneur and earn enough for a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin is a 45-year-old married man who lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. He and his wife own a few hectares of farmland, on which They cultivates rice for income. As usual, Yin uses his generated income for his daily sustenance and allowances for his children. He is responsible for five children, two of whom are already married and live separately around the province.

In order to improve his farming business, he would like to take out a loan of KHR 6,000,000 to purchase cows for the maintenance of the rice field. This loan will help him to reduce his plowing fees and enable him to manage his business well. He is very happy and appreciative for the given funds to help his family.

loans.use: To purchase cows for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 42 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin. She is married and has 3 children. 

Verginia has a mud boat fishing business and earns approximately PHP 10000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14900 to purchase to purchase materials for her mud boat use transportation for catching fish. 

Verginia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Verginia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her mud boat use transportation for catching fish

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 53 years old and lives in Caputol Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. 
Eleuteria sells firewood & native baskets wholesale. She has had this business for six (6) years. She requested a loan of 20000 to purchase a lot of firewood and native baskets for wholesale goods distribution.
Eleuteria has been a member of PMPC for twelve years.  In the future, Eleuteria hopes to finish her house to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of firewood and native baskets for wholesale goods distribution

loans.name: Tabita's Group

texts.en: Tabita is 50 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Clarin Mis. Occ. She is married and has two children. Tabita has a general store and earns approximately 3,000 each month doing this kind of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store. Tabita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Tabita hopes to be successful in her chosen business and can expand her business even in the neigboring town of Ozamiz City.Tabita is the leader of a  person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 60 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. 

Rosalita sells variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Rosalita hopes to own a house & improve her business someday.

loans.use: purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Orlando Group

texts.en:
Orlando is 46 years old and lives in Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga  Del Sur. He is married with 3 children.

Orlando sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Orlando has been member of PMPC for four years. In the future, he hopes to have his own fishing vessel.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

Victoria has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business. She is the same women in the previous picture because in the new photo she had she is newly recovered from the sickness she suffer and she became thin and long hair.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle's maintenance

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Lorna has a general store where she sells a variety of products such as oil, salt, sugar, and other items. She has had this business for twenty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, she hopes to own a house and to let her children finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lanie requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Lanie has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from general store and pig fattening.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosini

texts.en:
Rosini is 56 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosini is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosini has been raising pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en: Adilaida is 41 years old, married and the mother of 10 children. For the last 35 years, she has earned a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Adilaida earns additional income on the side by raising chickens, and is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is 60 years old and widowed with 2 children. Melchorita works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks to sell. Melchorita has been in this business for 8 years of selling charcoal.

In the future, Melchorita would like to save money and improve her living.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks to sell

loans.name: Darlen

texts.en: This time, Darlen is borrowing 29,000 PHP to buy grocery items and food stuff to sell in her general store. Darlen's business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, to continue to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is a 51-year-old married man and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Darhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his children are college students. He has had a farm since 2007. Now he owns a chicken farm and four greenhouses where he plants cucumbers. Also he makes pickles from cucumbers. His plants and chickens are all organic; therefore, he is a trusted supplier for many. However, he needs a new watering system for his greenhouses. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 3,900,000 MNT to buy a watering system for his greenhouses.

loans.use: To buy a watering system for his greenhouses

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has three children. For the last six years, she has made a living by cultivating coconuts. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Susana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a new loan, for 4,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns as a result of this loan to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Reycel

texts.en: Reycel is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, she manages the planting and harvesting of bananas to sell. She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Reycel joined GDMPC. Reycel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: 04.10.9  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to make and repair clothing.

Thúy is 33 years old and married with two children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 9 Nam Ngan solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2011, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Thúy has been involved in this business for three years. The main harship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thúy hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that she will make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines to make and repair clothes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman who has 5 children. She is 56 years old, and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gloria owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconuts to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 18,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: 04.7.9 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực has a business making nem chua (fermented/cured pork). She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

Thực is 58 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 9 Nam Ngan solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Her children are grown up.

In 2011, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thực has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thực has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thực faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thực hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

loans.name: Horloo

texts.en: Horloo is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband and her elder child help with her business, another child goes to college and the younger two go to school. Horloo operates an agriculture business. She started her business in 2006. She owns her own arable land, which is located 10 km from her house. She plants grass, cucumber, tomato and onion etc. She is a sharp and hardworking woman. Now that the agricultural season is approaching, she is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy organic seeds to plant more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy organic seeds to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda is 56 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rosenda used her last loan to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Marcela Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Marcela Virginia tiene cuarenta y seis años de edad está felizmente casada con el señor Conrado.
Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca donde la mayoría de las personas hablan el idioma Mixteco la actividad más importante es la siembra de maíz,frijol,chile,café,caña de azucar,cocos,tamarindo y ajonjolí.
Se dedica a la venta de  ropa, calzado y accesorios para dama  lleva vendiendo once años.
Primero empezó vendiendo calzado y con las ganancias  compro y con las ganancias de la ropa y la ayuda de fundacion compro accesorios para dama.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender a las personas y tener arreglado su local, nos dice que en las mañanas trabaja en una secundaria de su localidad de trabajadora social y su hija se queda a tendiendo el local  y en las tardes  se va ella  atender el local.
En las temporadas donde vende mas es el la fiesta de semana santa por compran ropa nueva y calzado  por que para todos los del pueblo es una fiesta especial.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más  ropa para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha dado  fundacion  para poder engrandecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcela Virginia is 46 years old and is happily married to her husband Conrad.  She lives in the city of Pinotepa Nacional in the state of Oaxaca, where the majority of people speak the Mixtec language.  The most important economic activity there is farming.  Local crops include corn, beans, chili peppers, coffee, sugarcane, coconuts, tamarind, and sesame seeds.

Marcela makes a living selling clothing, shoes, and women’s accessories, which she has done for eleven years now.  She began by selling shoes and then used her profits to buy clothing.  Later, with additional earnings and help from foundation, she purchased women’s accessories.  

What Marcela likes most about her business is attending to her customers and keeping her shop tidy.  In the mornings she works as a social worker at the local high school and so her daughter looks after the store for her, and then in the afternoons Marcela manages the store.    

Marcela’s most profitable time of year is Holy Week, since everyone in the community buys new clothes and shoes for the celebration.  She is asking for this loan so she can purchase more clothing, which she will sell both wholesale and retail.  

Marcela is grateful for the support she has received from the foundation in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is married with two children. She is 41 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lisa owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 12,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Lisa is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Lisa hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: 04.10.10 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a retail business selling food. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs, fish, noodles, etc to resell.

Mai is 57 years old and married with one child.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 10 Nam Ngan solidarity group. 

Mai lives with one dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mai's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

Mai has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, fish, noodles, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Alma May

texts.en:
Alma May is a 31-year-old married woman with two children living in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. In order to make additional income for the family, she entered into a business planting & harvesting flowers for sale five years ago. She usually earns 2,500 a month.

Alma May joined GDMPC in 2011 and she borrowed 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She was able to improve her business because of the money rendered to her. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina de  39 años, casada y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 18 y 22, es una mujer muy dinámica y emprendedora, que se dedica a la actividad comercial, mediante guías especializadas de productos, los cuales compra en empresas que hacen parte de la oferta en Colombia.  Su negocio lo inició desde hace 2 años, en los que ha comercializado con productos cosméticos naturales, poco a poco su clientela se ha incrementado, hasta llegar a consolidar su propia clientela, con la que cuenta para multiplicar su inversión, pero tiene un gran desafío y es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente para  hacer compras en volúmenes, tener un buen inventario y con ello lograr su empeño de crecer. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumes cosméticos, que llegaron en descuento, con buenos precios 
El dinamismo de Gina no se detiene, ella todos los días tiene visitas a clientes reales, potenciales, jornadas de recuperación de cartera y con todo esto se siente muy feliz, pues le permite estar en contacto con personas y a ella  le gusta el buen manejo de las relaciones interpersonales, pues  le ha hecho ganar un espacio en el segmento de mercado en el que interactúa y su posicionamiento en el nicho comercial. Su mayor sueño es tener un local, para abrir un almacén al público y su mayor satisfacción, es que ha logrado educar a sus hijos en excelentes instituciones educativas  y esto es el motor, por lo cual diariamente se levanta con mucha disposición de ánimo, para lograr que sus hijos tengan un potencial de éxito, haciendo ella lo que está al alcance de sus manos y mucho mas.
texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children (ages 18 and 22). She is a dynamic and enterprising woman who works in the retail trade. Gina sells products through specialty guides, which are purchased from companies that offer their merchandise in Colombia. She started her business two years ago by selling natural cosmetic products. Gina slowly gained more customers over time and now has an established clientele of her own. She is able to multiply her investment, but her greatest challenge is obtaining sufficient capital in order to buy in volume. By having a good inventory, she will be able to make her enterprise grow. This is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The money will be used to buy perfumes and cosmetics at good prices since she will be able to get a discount.

Gina's enthusiasm cannot be contained since she spends every day visiting with current and potential customers and also collecting her outstanding bills, which makes her happy. She stays in contact with people because she is good at managing interpersonal relationships. Gina has developed a niche in the marketplace and has earned a position for herself as a result of her personal interactions. Her greatest wish is to have a location where she can open a store to the public. What would give her the greatest satisfaction is seeing her children get an education at the finest institutions. This is the motivation that drives her to wake up each day with enthusiasm. Gina is taking matters into her own hands when it comes to seeing her children reach their potential for success.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sodnompil

texts.en: Sodnompil is 45 years old, a married man, and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, his older daughter is a university student and the other 3 children all go to school. He has 22 years of experience in the agricultural field. He has 14 hectares of his own land, which is located 15 km from Ulaangom soum, where he runs a business planting potatoes and other vegetables. Also he has 1 hectare of land near his house. He plants a variety of vegetables and organic fruits, such as sea-buckthorn and blackberry. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "It is hard to support college students. However, I'll do whatever I can in order to get my children educated." He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to build a fence around the land and to purchase organic seeds to plant vegetables.

loans.use: To build a fence around the land and to purchase organic seeds

loans.name: Zubaydullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло проживает в районе Хуросон. Он женат. Ему 35 лет. У него четверо детей. Он занимается скотоводством. В этой области Зубайдулло восемь лет. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Zubaydullo lives in the Khuroson district. He is 35 years old, married, and has four children. He works in animal husbandry, an activity he has been involved in for the past eight years. He is taking a loan to purchase some calves.

loans.use: to buy some calves.

loans.name: Charmen

texts.en:
For over nine years in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Charmen, a 29-year-old married mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business. She earns 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Charmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy nipa palm to make roofing materials

loans.name: Rovilla

texts.en: Rovilla is married and the mother of five dependents. She is 37 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Rovilla owns and operates a business buying and selling used clothes such as shorts, blouses, etc. She established the business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of work for 10 years. Rovilla requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. Rovilla is a member of GDMPC. In the future, Rovilla wants to purchase motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 46 years old, married and has 5 children; 3 of them are sons and 2 are daughters. Due to financial constraints, Robina couldn’t provide them an education. 

Her husband is a daily wage labor. His income is not guaranteed every day because sometimes he doesn’t get any work. 

Robina also supports her husband by sewing clothes for her community ladies. She is a very talented sewing expert and receives a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her current sewing machine is creating problems and she is unable to meet the deadlines. She is confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine, her business will improve and she will be able to earn more profits for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 35 лет,  воспитывает 3 детей школьного возраста.   В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Анара начала свой бизнес в торговле женской  и детской одеждой со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Анара сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Анара обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Анара  планирует вложить в ремонт квартиры, а в дальнейшем -  в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anara is 35 years old and raising three school-age children.

In 2000, in search of a source of income to support her family, she started her own business selling women's and children's clothes with an initial amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Through persistence and hard work, Anara was able to expand her business and she is now making a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). 

Her assortment of merchandise is currently limited, and this is why she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  

With the earnings from her loan, Anara is planning to perform some repairs in her apartment and, in the future, she will invest her profits into expanding her business.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia is married with three children. She is 49 years old and lives in Macabibo, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lidia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Lidia is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Lidia hopes for business expansion one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a widow. She has spent most of her life in crisis particularly after the death of her husband a few years ago. 

She never lost heart and started her business making and selling parandas and elastics. Parandas are a typical product used to tie a woman's hair firmly and are very popular among ladies. 

She collects orders from different shops and fulfills their orders on time to earn an income. She has given birth to a daughter who lives with her and supports her in her work. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy raw materials such as thread and beads to be able to make a larger quantity of parandas and also she'll buy elastics in a larger quantity to be able to fulfill the client demands and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make parandas (hair ornaments) and elastics to sell

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is a married woman with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She operates a grocery store selling her goods to the general public at the market. She narrates that she faces a scarcity of vegetables during the dry season and that she spends more on school fees during the month. Zipporah dreams of opening a cereal shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the loan, she intends to purchase cereals.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermenegilda; La socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio desde las 06:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como aceite y golosinas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Hermenegilda is a member of the Communal Bank "Kukuli", which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She continues to manage her grocery business. Hermenegilda sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. She works every day at her business between 6am to about 10pm. Hermenegilda feels that she can help her family get ahead in this manner. She wants to continue working so that she can support her family.

Hermenegilda is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, such as oil and candy. She is grateful to everyone who contributed toward fulfilling her dream in this manner and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con sus padres, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, aprendió de su padre, trabajan juntos todos los días, Walter considera que ha ganado experiencia con este trabajo.
Él está realizando una siembra con su padre, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra su gasto en abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada, ya que son los materiales necesarios para realizar la siembra, permitiéndole que sus cosechas aumenten la productividad.
El objetivo de Walter es trabajar con su padre, mejorar los cultivos, aprender lo suficiente para seguir realizando las siembras.
texts.en:
Walter is 23 years old and lives with his parents. His work involves cultivating corn and beans. He learned this trade from his father and the two of them work together every day. Walter says that he has gained experience through his work. He and his father will be planting, so Walter is requesting a loan to cover the cost of compost, herbicides, and improved seeds. These are the necessary materials that are required for planting and will help him achieve a harvest with increased productivity.

Walter's objectives are to work with his father, improve his crops, and learn enough to continue with the planting process.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, and improved seeds.

loans.name: Chhuop's Group

texts.en:
Chhuop is 30 years old and married with three children, all of them are still in school and dependent on the family. They live in Mongkul Borey district. 

As a parent, Chhuop and her husband support their family through farming rice and growing crops. Chhuop has obtained loans from VisionFund for five cycles and now she is applying for the sixth cycle after completely repaying all her previous financial obligations to VisionFund, while her other group member is applying for his first loan. Having a good record with VisionFund, Chhuop is now acting as a loan group leader. 

Chhuop plans to use her portion of the loan to cultivate her farmland, buy fertilizers and renovate her house. With this loan, she hopes to make a better living for her family.

loans.use: cultivate her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 38, resident of Batasan hills, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Candelario, an installer, and father to their six children. She manages the household while attending to her business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a water refilling station. In the Philippines, a water refilling station is an alternative source of drinking water that sells purified water, distilled, ionized and alkaline water. Aside from the water refilling station business, she also has an RTW business; this is the term for factory-made clothing, sold in finished condition, in standardized sizes, as distinct from made-to-measure or bespoke clothing tailored to a particular person's frame. She manages this business together with her husband. 

Elsa earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day at her water refilling station, and PHP 500 at their RTW store.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to invest more in her business, buying related products or materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsa hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to maintain the growth of her business and be able to support the schooling of her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mineral water and RTW products needed in her business

loans.name: Rostico

texts.en:
Rostico is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has nine children.

Rostico has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs like pollard, hog grower, hog starter, and hog finisher.

Rostico has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy pollard and animal feed.

loans.name: Qui

texts.en: Qui is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more "yakult" (Indonesia fermented milk drink) to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from Sumirap, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Grace is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Grace works in someone else's business venture. She sells food products. Grace has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Grace joined GDMPC. Grace is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to buy products for her mini-store which is just started after her loan release. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy products for her mini-store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of  fertilizers for  the vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
In 2000, Sanu established her vegetable farming business. She is 45 years old, married and has two children, ages 22 and 19. Working 6 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

Sanu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Sanu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tour's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old widow, Tour lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She has two two children. To make a living, she has been farming rice on two-hectare farmland for four years as a primary business to support her children alone. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to support her business.

Tour's group consists of two members who live in the same village. Tour has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles while the other member Nhoem is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loans from VisionFund have helped Tour grow her rice successfully with good yield. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice with good quality so as to sell it for good price and she hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kilonzo

texts.en:
Kilonzo is a 28 year-old married to Rose and blessed with two children aged six and two years respectively.  He rears pigs, a business he started one year ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more piglets for rearing and selling later. The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan. 

He dreams of being a successful businessman as well as bringing up a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for rearing and selling later.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 30 year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Robert. They have two children aged 12 and three years.

Carol operates a restaurant in Kisumu, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD that she will use to buy fish to supply to her customers, and also for use in the restaurant. 

Her profits will be used to expand the restaurant food stock. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy fish for use in the restaurant, and also supply to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 53 years-old and is a married woman with five children, two of whom still attend school. Magdalena's husband works as a carpenter and driver.

Magdalena has had a sari-sari store business for quite some time now. She sells soft drinks, purified water, and toiletries. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income from the store. However, Magdalena also experiences times when there's almost nothing left to reinvest in her store. She hopes for her daily income to increase so she can help more with their household needs. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, and toiletries. Magdalena hopes for her sari-sari store business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, and toiletries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is taking out another loan to start a new business. With the loan, she plans to service her bodaboda (motorcycle), which was involved in an accident. Since the last loan, her business has been doing well and she has been able to expand her business and purchase a motorcycle to operate another business. Her family's living standards have also improved.

loans.use: to service her bodaboda (motorcycle).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, shampoo, and snacks.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is operating a food stall that has been running for the past six months. She has three children attending school. Amina operates her food stall from her home; her customers are her neighbors. She dreams of opening a hotel in future. Price inflation of commodities is her major challenge. Amina lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Food is her greatest monthly expense. She plans to use the loan of Ksh 20,000 to add stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years-old, married, and a mother of three children. She operates a barber shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add inventory of hair cut machines, hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes needed for her business. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, Esther hopes to grow her barber shop as she intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to buy hair cut machines, hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Sofiya

texts.ru: София проживает в районе Хуросон. Она замужем. Ей 48 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается животноводством. Кредит берет закупа телят и овец.
texts.en:
Sofiya lives in the Khuroson region. She is married. She is 48 years old and has four children. She is engaged in livestock breeding.

Sofiya takes a loan for the purchase of calves and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru:
Суйумкан 53 года, замужем, имеет 6 детей. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Суйумкан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 1976 году. Благодаря упорному труду Суйумкан,  ее хозяйство, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом  насчитывает 3 коровы, 13 овец, 14 коз и 3 лошади, что позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суйумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Suyumkan is 53 years old, married and has six children. As the main source of income for her family, Suyumkan is engaged in livestock breeding, after having started this business in 1976. Thanks to Suyumkan's hard work, her farm, which was started with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS), now counts 3 cows, 13 sheep, 14 goats and 3 horses. This allows her to make a profit in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Suyumkan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. Suyumkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Qumriniso

texts.ru: Кумринисо- женщина старших лет,у неё четыре сына, последнего хочет женить. Для этого она уже готовится- копит приданое для невесты.В наших краях по старинному обряду сторона жениха должна подарить калым-приданное перед свадьбой.все эти подарки дорогие и поэтому для такого мероприятия готовятся несколько лет.Кумринисо работает в больнице санитаркой и узнав от своих коллег про наши услуги, она пришла в нашу организацию за кредитом.Условия частичного погашения понравились ей и она получила первый кредит для своих нужд.Так как в её семье сыновья, невестки и её муж работают, в погашении ей помогали и  она не затруднилась покрыть свой кредит.Теперь она намерена всегда с нами работать- получая круглую сумму она покрывает свои крупные расходы.
texts.en:
Qumriniso is an older woman, who has four sons, and the youngest wants to marry. Qumriniso has prepared for this, saving a dowry for the bride. In our area, according to the old ritual, the groom's family should give dowry before the wedding. All these gifts are expensive and therefore one needs to prepare several years for this arrangement. 

Qumriniso works as a nurse at the hospital and after having been told about our services by her colleague, she came to our organization for a loan. She liked the terms of partial payment and she received her first loan for her needs. As the sons, daughters in law and husband of her family works, they help her with the repayment, and she does not find it difficult to cover her loan. Currently she intends to continue working with us - receiving a round sum it covers her major costs.

loans.use: to buy dowry for the bride of her son

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор- молодой мужчина,хороший семьянин и имеет одного ребенка.Живет в одном доме с родителями и младшим братом,у которого тоже своя семья.Эта семья работает в бюджетной сфере и каждый работает и старается внести свой вклад в семью.Абдусаттор  имеет большой стаж и опыт работы в медицинской сфере несмотря на молодой возраст.Он работает в инфекционной больнице врачом, в центре переливания крови и т.д.Более того, у него частные приемы на дому и это тоже определенный доход.Но это все уходит на семейные расходы а именно на продукты питания.На полученный кредит Абдусаттор хочет приобрести бытавую технику.Он работает с нами более двух лет. Когда у него в семье намечается крупные расходы, он обращается к нам и уверен, что может положится на нашу помощь.
texts.en:
Abdusattor is a young man, a good family man, and he has one child. They live in the same house as his parents and younger brother, who also has his own family. The family works in the public sector and each works and tries to contribute to the family. 

Abdusattor has a strong record and large experience in working in the medical field, even at his young age. He works as a doctor in the hospital for infectious diseases, in the center for blood transfusion and similar. In addition to this he has private consultations at his home and receives additional income form this. But this all goes to family expenses, namely for food products. 

For the loan received Abdusattor wants to purchase home appliances. He has worked with us for two years already. When his family plans for larger expenses, he turns to us and trusts that he can rely on our help.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, tiene la edad 38 de  años, está casado y vive con sus dos hijos y la esposa actualmente. El  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de  tres novillos y además alimento  para el engorde de los mismos. El cuenta con varios novillos  a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio y  darle alimentación con miel y pasto picado  para su engorde más rápido. El  quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de novillos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Guillermo is 38 years old, he is married and he lives with his wife and their two children. He wants to invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of three steers and animal feed to fatten them. Even if he owns many steers, he wants to strengthen his activity and to feed his animals with honey and chopped grasses so that they will fatten more quickly. He wants his animals to have the ideal weight to then sell them in the market of his community or in the neighboring villages. He would like to earn the best possible income for his family’s wellbeing, as well as to grow with the steer raising project. This is the first loan he receives from FUDECOSUR. He hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy three steers.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 19 años de edad, aun no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia con su familia, él aprendió el trabajo agrícola por su padre, quien le enseño a realizarlo, Trabaja solo desde hace tres años.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, porque se dispone a sembrar, utilizando abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada, con el objetivo de tener mejores resultados, con este préstamo José contara con los recursos económicos que le permitan realizar la siembra con todo lo necesario.
El objetivo de José es mejorar su trabajo, su economía familiar y ofrece a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is a farmer and he plants maize and beans. He is 19 years old, he has no children and lives in his family in their own house. His father taught him to work as a farmer, and he has been working on his own for the past three years.
He is requesting a loan to buy agriculture supplies: he is about to start sowing, using manure, weed-killers and improved seeds, aiming at obtaining the best results. Thanks to this loan, José will have the necessary economic means to get everything he needs to till his lands.
José’s goal is to grow with his activity, to improve his family’s economy and to offer a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy manure, weed-killers and improved seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de un niño de un año, es madre soltera, tiene casa propia, la granja tiene 5 años de tenerla en su propia casa, lo instalo por iniciativa propia.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos y concentrado, con esto espera tener lo necesario para aumentar la granja y sus ganancias, con este préstamo podrá realizar la inversión y continuar en sus quehaceres.
El objetivo de Rosa es mejorar su economía, para tener una mejor calidad de vida que le permita tener lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rosa's business is raising pigs.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of a one-year-old child.  Her farm is located on her property and she set it up on her own initiative.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy two pigs and concentrated feed.  With this purchase, she hopes to have what she needs to increase the size of her farm and her profits.  This loan will enable her to make this investment and continue with her work.

Rosa's goal is to improve her finances so that she can enjoy a better quality of life that allows her to have what she needs.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Las Violetas 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Violetas 1 esta conformado por  diez mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas.
Son originarias de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde la  se elaboran los machetes grabados Pinotepa Nacional se significa “hacia el cerro desmoronado”.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Virginia Ines de cincuenta años de edad  es una señora alegre humilde  y muy trabajadora.
Doña Viki como mejor la conocen se dedica a la venta de dulces  desde hace cuatro años nos dice que le ama mucho su trabajo por que le costo mucho engrandecerlo.
Vende también lo que es bolis, sabritas, refrescos, chicharrones y frutas con chile pone su mesa  y su mercancía y como cerca de su casa hay una escuela primaria los niños cuando salen al recreo le compran los dulces y cuando salen de clases pasan a comprar sus dulces, le gusta mucho convivir con los niños y tratarlos bien ya que ellos son sus mas grandes clientes y ellos están contentos con ella.
Ella logro tener este negocio comprando primero lo que  con refrescos y un poco de dulces y con esas ganancias fue comprando mas y mas dulces y con la ayuda de fundacion logro comprar mas mercancía y  mas dulces y frutas para los niños.
Dice que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y eso la hace muy feliz por que su trabajo es una de las cosas mas lindas que tiene.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de más dulces, refrescos, jugos, sabritas, chicharrones, palomitas y frutas para la venta.
Esta muy contenta ya que fundacion le ayudado a mejorar su negocio y sus nivel de vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son
Ines Lourdes- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Alma Rosa- se dedica a la venta de libros.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de libros.
Maria de Jesus – se dedica a la venta de pan.
Julia- se dedica ala venta de dulces.
Mayran Nallely- se dedica a la venta de cortinas.
Laura Catalina- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Maribel- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Esther- se dedica a la venta de catálogos.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudara  a todas las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called Violetas 1 and is made up of ten hardworking and humble women that make a living doing different economic activities. They are from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, where engraved machetes are made. Pinotepa Nacional means "towards the crumbling hill."

One of the members of the group is fifty-year-old Virginia Ines. She's a happy, humble, and very hardworking woman. Ms. Viki, as she's better known, has made a living selling sweets for four years. She tells us that she loves her job a lot because it took her a lot to grow it. She also sells ice cream treats, potato chips, soft drinks, pork cracklings, and fruit with chile. She sets up her table and merchandise, and as there is an elementary school near her home, children buy sweets from her at recess and stop by to buy sweets after school finished. She really likes to spend time with children and treat them well since they are her biggest customers and they are happy with her. She achieved having this business by first buying soft drinks and a few sweets, and with these earnings she bought more and more sweets. With the help of the foundation she achieved buying more merchandise, sweets, and fruit for the children.

She says that her business leaves her with good earnings. This makes her happy because her job is one of the nicest things she has. She requested the loan to buy more sweets, soft drinks, juice, potato chips, pork cracklings, popcorn, and fruit to sell. She is very happy that the foundation is helping her improve her business and quality of life.

The other members of the group are:

Ines Lourdes, who makes a living selling food.
Alma Rosa, who makes a living selling books.
Margarita, who makes a living selling books.
Maria de Jesus, who makes a living selling bread.
Julia, who makes a living selling sweets.
Mayran Nallely, who makes a living selling curtains.
Laura Catalina, who makes a living selling soft drinks.
Maribel, who makes a living selling clothing.
Esther, who makes a living selling catalogs.


She thanks the foundation for helping all the hardworking women.

loans.use: to buy sweets to sell.

loans.name: Martin Enrique

texts.es:
Martin, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres, tienen casa propia, él ayuda a su padre en el cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, ha aprendido bien lo necesario para realizar este trabajo, su hermanos tambien colaboran para poder sostenerse en el hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla de maíz, para sembrar en esta temporada, este préstamo les ayudara a prestar el dinero necesario para invertirlo en su cultivo, esperando tener una buena productividad.
La aspiración de Martin es salir adelante con su familia, apoyándose, realizando lo necesario para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Martin is 19 years old and lives with his parents who own their own home.  He helps his father to grow corn and raise livestock.  He has learned everything he needs to know in order to carry out this work.  His siblings also help to support the household.

Martin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides and corn seeds to sow this season.  The loan will help him to have the money he needs to invest in his crops.  He hopes to enjoy a good yield.

Martin's goal is to make progress, supporting his family, doing what he needs to so that they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and corn seed

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con sus padres, tiene 23 años de edad, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, está soltero, él aprendió su trabajo porque en su hogar su padre es agricultor, tiene 6 años de trabajar con él.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla, abono y herbicidas, para iniciar la nueva siembra de esta temporada, con este préstamo contara con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la inversión y desarrollar la siembra, esperando tener una buena productividad.
El objetivo de Carlos es mejorar su economía a través del trabajo porque de esta manera le ofrecerá a su familia un ingreso más para cubrir las necesidades.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his parents, is 23 years old, and works growing corn and beans. He is single and learned his job because at home his father is a farmer and he's been working with him for six years.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicide in order to begin new planting this season. With this loan he will have the necessary money to be able to make the investment and develop his planting. He hopes to have good productivity.

Carlos' objective is to improve his finances through his work because in this way he will offer his family another income to cover necessities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KUKULI;la socia Yony continua con su negocio de elaboracion de artesania como muñecas que ella misma los hace para luego repartirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan como tiendas de regalos,la socia a la vez es docente ella trabaja de lunes a viernes por la mañana,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.
 
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de las muñecas como hilos de colores ,telas y agujas de diferentes tamaños.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yony belongs to the Kukuli community bank.  She continues in her business making handicrafts such as dolls.  Yony makes the items herself and then delivers them to customers, such as gift shops, who request them from her.  At the same time, Yony works as a teacher.  She works Monday to Friday, in the mornings.  She is a cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to continue working for her family.  

Yony is requesting this loan to buy materials for making dolls such as colored threads, fabric and different-sized needles.

Yony is grateful for the loan she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dolls such as colored threads, fabric and different-sized needles

loans.name: Wilmer Ulises

texts.es:
Wilmer, trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, Wilmer tiene siete años de estar dedicándose a la siembra el cual lo aprendió de su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, y otros insumos, que son necesarios para aplicar a la siembra que le ayudan a proteger y prevenir de las plagas, este préstamo le ayudara a Wilmer, porque tendrá los recursos necesarios para que su cultivo sea productivo.
La aspiración de él es continuar trabajando de la mejor manera, con el objetivo de mejorar la producción en sus cultivos, para sustentar sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer works as a farmer. He's 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children of 3 years and 1 year of age. Wilmer has been making a living planting crops for seven years as his father taught him.

He is requesting a loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides, and other supplies which are necessary to apply to the crops as they help him protect them and prevent pests. This loan will help Wilmer because he will have the necessary resources for his crop to be productive.

His aspiration is to continue working in the best way possible with the objective of improving the production of his crop. This is so that he is able to support his and his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es:
Jhon tiene 23 años, es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo con un entusiasmo y un optimismo que contagia, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad en la cual se encuentran playas hermosas y atractivos turísticos que enamoran a más de uno de los cuales son las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas, también se desarrolla la agricultura y la pesca. Los fines de semana o cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, en algunas oportunidades le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo ceviche mixto con su chilcano, es una delicia; el nos comenta que solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administración de empresas.

De sol a sol Jhon sale a trabajar en su negocio de venta de comida, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una muy buena sazón lapa la preparación de los platillos y por ello los clientes se sienten satisfechos con lo que el ofrece.

Jhon está muy feliz y agradecido con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su local como pintado, tarrajeo y refacción de pequeñas rajaduras, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá un local en mejores condiciones para atender a sus clientes y sobre todo brindara una mejor atención, asimismo el podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y estudiar la carrera de administración”.
texts.en:
Jhon is 23 years old.  He is a very hard-working young man who has a lot of enthusiasm and a contagious level of optimism.  He lives in the city of Pisco which has beautiful beaches and tourist attractions that win over the hearts of visitors.  These attractions include the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabra of the Andes (a prehistoric geoglyph).  People in the area farm and fish.  On weekends, or whenever he has a little free time, Jhon enjoys playing football with his friends and neighbors.  He also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes: delicious ceviche (a fish dish marinated in citrus juice) together with a glass of pisco (grape brandy).  Jhon tells us that he only completed his secondary education but he would have liked to have gone on to study for a degree in business.

From morning til night, Jhon works in his business selling food.  He works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 40 customers.  He believes that his business is doing well because the dishes he prepares are very tasty and so his customers are happy with what he sells.

Jhon is very happy and grateful to receive the help that Kiva lenders have offered him.  Thanks to their help, he will be able to make some improvements to his premises, painting, tiling and plastering over some small cracks.  This will improve the condition of the premises in which he serves his customers and he will be able to provide a better service.  He will also be able to continue working hard so that he can accomplish his biggest dream: to own his own home and study for a business degree.

loans.use: to improve his premises (painting, tiling, plastering cracks, etc.)

loans.name: Nyakagezi / Zz Group

texts.fr:
Thémistocle fait partie du groupe Nyakagezi /Zz. Le nom du groupe signifie «Name of the valley ». Il a 28  ans, il est célibataire. Il a  1 personne dans son charge .Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Thémistocle est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture, il planifie de cultiver d’une façon moderne. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour agrandir son agriculture. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’acheter un véhicule qui va l’aide à faire son business, construire une maison pour sa famille et payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thémistocle is a member of the Nyakagezi /Zz group.The group’s name means « Name of the valley ».He is 28 and single. He has one person dependent on him. His education level is 6th secondary.
Thémistocle is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ABC. He will use his credit to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labour.
To expand his exploitation, he plans to use modern methods of cultivation. Over the coming years he would like to purchase more fields to enlarge his farm. With the profits he plans to buy a vehicle which will help him to go about his business, build a house for his family, and pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza, se dedica a la venta de medicinas y granos básicos, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, uno de ellos esta estudiando, Maritza tiene 5 años en el negocio, lo aprendió con sus padres, tambien vende granos básicos, con esta ocupación ha logrado ayudar a su esposo por varios años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, frijoles, clorofila, omega, psylium en polvo y cascara sagrada, todos estos productos son los que ofrece en el negocio,  ayudándole a incrementar su inventario y poder mejorar sus ventas.
La aspiración de Maritza es fortalecer aun más el negocio,  ya que así estará asegurándose un mejor futuro con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza's business is selling natural medicines and basic grains.  She lives with her husband and her two children, one of whom is in school.  Maritza has been in her business for five years.  She learned it from her parents.  She also sells basic grains.  Through her work, she has managed to help her husband for several years.

Maritza is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, chlorophyll, omega, powdered psyllium and sacred bark (rhamnus purshiana).  These are all products that she sells in her business and so this will help her to increase her stock and improve her sales.

Maritza's goal is to further strengthen her business as it will allow her to guarantee a good future for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, chlorophyll, omega, powdered psyllium and sacred bark (rhamnus purshiana)

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia en zona rural; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, lleva varios años de dedicarse al ámbito de la agricultura, se siente orgulloso pues esto le ha regalado valiosa experiencia para mejorar en sus siembras y obtener las mejores cosechas; se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija ya que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente siempre está a la orden de las personas que lo solicitan; Luis es un hombre dedicado a su labor, humilde y muy agradecido, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades para así en un futuro cercano obtener el éxito que toda persona desea, ahora que quiere aumentar la producción en las cosechas necesita de capital para invertir, por eso se ha decidido solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, fertilizantes, insecticida y herramienta. Luis Antonio es responsable y tiene la confianza que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá cancelar el financiamiento y al mismo tiempo podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, age 46, lives with his life companion and their two children in their home in a rural area. He cultivates corn and sorghum and has been working in an agricultural setting for several years. Luis is proud that he has gained valuable experience, which has helped to improve his crops and resulted in better harvests. He has many established customers already because what he sells is of good quality and sold at affordable prices. In addition, his service is excellent since he is always fulfilling the requests of the people who order from him.

Luis is a man who is dedicated to his work, humble, and very appreciative. He is always expecting new opportunities in the near future to achieve the success that every person desires. Now he wants to increase his crop production, but he needs capital to invest. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral which will allow him to buy corn seeds, sorghum, fertilizers, insecticides, and tools. Luis Antonio is responsible and confident that the profit he earns will enable him to repay the loan. At the same, he will be able to provide a full life for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, sorghum, fertilizers, insecticides, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shorts and sandals

loans.name: Virginia Jeannette

texts.es:
Virginia, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, administra una panadería, con su familia trabajan en la elaboración del pan, este negocio comenzó gracias al apoyo de su familia, trabajan en la vivienda, no tienen un horario establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, azúcar, huevos, levadura, entre otros que son necesarios para realizar la producción, este préstamo le servirá para realizar la inversión y contar con los materiales necesarios en la panadería.
El objetivo de Virginia es crecer, aumentando el número de clientes, y ofreciendo a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia lives with her husband and three children.  She runs a bakery and works together with her family, baking bread.  She started this business with the support of her family.  They work at home and do not work regular hours.
